00062 
00077 Byte::Byte(const string &n) : BaseType(n, dods_byte_c)
00078 {
00079 }
00080 
00081 Byte::Byte(const Byte &copy_from) : BaseType(copy_from)
00082 {
00083     _buf = copy_from._buf;
00084 }
00085     
00086 BaseType *
00087 Byte::ptr_duplicate()
00088 {
00089     return new Byte(*this);
00090 }
00091 
00092 Byte &
00093 Byte::operator=(const Byte &rhs)
00094 {
00095     if (this == &rhs)
00096     return *this;
00097 
00098     dynamic_cast<BaseType &>(*this) = rhs;
00099 
00100     _buf = rhs._buf;
00101 
00102     return *this;
00103 }
00104 
00105 unsigned int
00106 Byte::width()
00107 {
00108     return sizeof(dods_byte);
00109 }
00110 
00124 bool
00125 Byte::serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink, bool ce_eval)
00126 {
00127     dds.timeout_on();
00128 
00129     if (!read_p())
00130     read(dataset);      // read() throws Error and InternalErr
00131 
00132     if (ce_eval && !dds.eval_selection(dataset))
00133     return true;
00134 
00135     dds.timeout_off();
00136 
00137     if (!xdr_char(sink, (char *)&_buf))
00138     throw Error(
00139 "Network I/O Error. Could not send byte data.\n\
00140 This may be due to a bug in DODS, on the server or a\n\
00141 problem with the network connection.");
00142 
00143     return true;
00144 }
00145 
00149 bool
00150 Byte::deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *, bool)
00151 {
00152     if (!xdr_char(source, (char *)&_buf))
00153     throw Error(
00154 "Network I/O Error. Could not read byte data. This may be due to a\n\
00155 bug in DODS or a problem with the network connection.");
00156 
00157     return false;
00158 }
00159 
00165 unsigned int
00166 Byte::val2buf(void *val, bool)
00167 {
00168   // Jose Garcia
00169   // This method is public therefore and I believe it has being designed
00170   // to be use by read which must be implemented on the surrogated library,
00171   // thus if the pointer val is NULL, is an Internal Error. 
00172   if(!val)
00173     throw InternalErr("the incoming pointer does not contain any data.");
00174 
00175     _buf = *(dods_byte *)val;
00176 
00177     return width();
00178 }
00179 
00180 unsigned int
00181 Byte::buf2val(void **val)
00182 {
00183   // Jose Garcia
00184   // The same comment justifying throwing an Error in val2buf applies here.
00185   if (!val)
00186     throw InternalErr("NULL pointer");
00187   
00188     if (!*val)
00189     *val = new dods_byte;
00190 
00191     *(dods_byte *)*val = _buf;
00192 
00193     return width();
00194 }
00195 
00196 // Print BUF to stdout with its declaration. Intended mostly for debugging.
00197 
00198 void 
00199 Byte::print_val(ostream &os, string space, bool print_decl_p)
00200 {
00201     if (print_decl_p) {
00202     print_decl(os, space, false);
00203     os << " = " << (int)_buf << ";" << endl;
00204     }
00205     else 
00206     os << (int)_buf;
00207 }
00208 
00209 void 
00210 Byte::print_val(FILE *out, string space, bool print_decl_p)
00211 {
00212     if (print_decl_p) {
00213     print_decl(out, space, false);
00214     fprintf( out, " = %d;\n", (int)_buf ) ;
00215     }
00216     else 
00217     fprintf( out, "%d", (int)_buf ) ;
00218 }
00219 
00220 bool
00221 Byte::ops(BaseType *b, int op, const string &dataset)
00222 {
00223     
00224     // Extract the Byte arg's value.
00225     if (!read_p() && !read(dataset)) {
00226       cerr << "This value not read!" << endl;
00227       // Jose Garcia
00228       // Since the read method is virtual and implemented outside
00229       // libdap++ if we can not read the data that is the problem 
00230       // of the user or of whoever wrote the surrogate library
00231       // implemeting read therefore it is an internal error.
00232       throw InternalErr("This value not read!");
00233     }
00234 
00235     // Extract the second arg's value.
00236     if (!b->read_p() && !b->read(dataset)) {
00237       cerr << "This value not read!" << endl;
00238       // Jose Garcia
00239       // Since the read method is virtual and implemented outside
00240       // libdap++ if we can not read the data that is the problem 
00241       // of the user or of whoever wrote the surrogate library
00242       // implemeting read therefore it is an internal error.
00243       throw InternalErr("This value not read!");
00244     }
00245 
00246     switch (b->type()) {
00247       case dods_byte_c:
00248     return rops<dods_byte, dods_byte, Cmp<dods_byte, dods_byte> >
00249         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Byte *>(b)->_buf, op);
00250       case dods_int16_c:
00251     return rops<dods_byte, dods_int16, USCmp<dods_byte, dods_int16> >
00252         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Int16 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00253       case dods_uint16_c:
00254     return rops<dods_byte, dods_uint16, Cmp<dods_byte, dods_uint16> >
00255         (_buf, dynamic_cast<UInt16 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00256       case dods_int32_c:
00257     return rops<dods_byte, dods_int32, USCmp<dods_byte, dods_int32> >
00258         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Int32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00259       case dods_uint32_c:
00260     return rops<dods_byte, dods_uint32, Cmp<dods_byte, dods_uint32> >
00261         (_buf, dynamic_cast<UInt32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00262       case dods_float32_c:
00263     return rops<dods_byte, dods_float32, Cmp<dods_byte, dods_float32> >
00264         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Float32 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00265       case dods_float64_c:
00266     return rops<dods_byte, dods_float64, Cmp<dods_byte, dods_float64> >
00267         (_buf, dynamic_cast<Float64 *>(b)->_buf, op);
00268       default:
00269     return false;
00270     }
00271 }

00277 // depracated.

00279 // the new server timeouts are active only for the data read and CE
00280 // evaluation. This went inthe BaseType::serialize() methods because it
00281 // needed to time both the read() calls and the dds::eval() calls.

00322 // Revision 1.44  2001/10/14 01:28:38  jimg

00325 // Revision 1.41.4.4  2001/10/02 17:01:52  jimg
00326 // Made the behavior of serialize and deserialize uniform. Both methods now
00327 // use Error exceptions to signal problems with network I/O and InternalErr
00328 // exceptions to signal other problems. The return codes, always true for
00329 // serialize and always false for deserialize, are now meaningless. However,
00330 // by always returning a code that means OK, old code should continue to work.
00331 //
00332 // Revision 1.43  2001/09/28 17:50:07  jimg
00333 // Merged with 3.2.7.
00334 //
00335 // Revision 1.41.4.3  2001/09/07 00:38:34  jimg
00336 // Sequence::deserialize(...) now reads all the sequence values at once.
00337 // Its call semantics are the same as the other classes' versions. Values
00338 // are stored in the Sequence object using a vector<BaseType *> for each
00339 // row (those are themselves held in a vector). Three new accessor methods
00340 // have been added to Sequence (row_value() and two versions of var_value()).
00341 // BaseType::deserialize(...) now always returns true. This matches with the
00342 // expectations of most client code (the seqeunce version returned false
00343 // when it was done reading, but all the calls for sequences must be changed
00344 // anyway). If an XDR error is found, deserialize throws InternalErr.
00345 //
00346 // Revision 1.42  2001/08/24 17:46:22  jimg
00347 // Resolved conflicts from the merge of release 3.2.6
00348 //
00349 // Revision 1.41.4.2  2001/08/18 00:19:18  jimg
00350 // Removed WIN32 compile guards from using statements.
00351 //
00352 // Revision 1.41.4.1  2001/07/28 01:10:41  jimg
00353 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00354 // I added those where they were needed.
00355 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00356 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00357 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00358 // just good form when using delete.
00359 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00360 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00361 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00362 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00363 // characters on their own.
00364 //
00365 // Revision 1.41  2000/10/06 01:26:04  jimg
00366 // Changed the way serialize() calls read(). The status from read() is
00367 // returned by the Structure and Sequence serialize() methods; ignored by
00368 // all others. Any exceptions thrown by read() are caught and discarded.
00369 // serialize() returns false if read() throws an exception. This should
00370 // be fixed once all the servers build using the new read() definition.
00371 //
00372 // Revision 1.40  2000/09/22 02:17:19  jimg

00377 //
00378 // Revision 1.39  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00379 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00380 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00381 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00382 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00383 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00384 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
00385 //

00534 // Revision 1.7  1995/03/04  14:34:41  jimg
00535 // Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00536 // Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00537 // contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00538 // Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00539 // class represenation.
00540 // Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00541 // types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00542 // an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00543 // Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00544 // objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00545 // C would store them.
00546 // Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00547 // an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00548 // objects).
